title: MELD Score (Original, Pre-2016, Model for End-Stage Liver Disease)
desc: The MELD Score (Model For End-Stage Liver Disease) (12 and older) quantifies end-stage liver disease for transplant planning.

orgreference.text: Kamath PS, Wiesner RH, Malinchoc M, Kremers W, Therneau TM, Kosberg CL, D'Amico G, Dickson ER, Kim WR. A model to predict survival in patients with end-stage liver disease. Hepatology. 2001 Feb;33(2):464-70.

other_refer.text: Kremers WK, van IJperen M, Kim WR, Freeman RB, Harper AM, Kamath PS, Wiesner RH. MELD score as a predictor of pretransplant and posttransplant survival in OPTN/UNOS status 1 patients.Hepatology. 2004 Mar;39(3):764-9.
Kamath PS, Kim WR; Advanced Liver Disease Study Group. The model for end-stage liver disease (MELD).Hepatology. 2007 Mar;45(3):797-805.

data.evidence:
Original MELD Score = (0.957 * ln(Serum Cr) + 0.378 * ln(Serum Bilirubin) + 1.120 * ln(INR) + 0.643 ) * 10 (if hemodialysis, value for Creatinine is automatically set to 4.0)

Note: If any score is <1, the MELD assumes the score is equal to 1.

This is the pre-2016 MELD which does not include serum sodium level, as non-US transplant societies are still using the original MELD formula. See the newer MELD formula here.

inputs.label_en: Dialysis at least twice in the past week
